required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Exercise in the Functional Capacity, Central Artery and Rigidity Ankle Brachial Index
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Combined Force Training Aerobic Versus Aerobic in the Functional Capacity, Central Artery and Rigidity Ankle Brachial Index in Patients With Peripheral Artery Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: The Peripheral Arterial Disease prevalence is around 3-10 % of the world population. Exercise plays an important role in treating these patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Objective: To investigate the effects of training Combined Aerobic - Strength versus aerobic functional capacity, ankle brachial index (ABI ) and central arterial stiffness in patients with peripheral arterial disease

arm_group.description: Aerobic training on a treadmill continuously with speed and wave periodization. Frequency twice per week ( 2x ) for twelve weeks
strength training with free weights, followed by active recovery on a treadmill with fixed intervals of 60 to 120 seconds between each workforce of series.

intervention.description: Aerobic training on a treadmill continuously with speed and wave periodization. Frequency twice per week ( 2x ) for twelve weeks. Device: treadmill.

Device: treadmill Train_Comb_aerobic. strength training with free weights, followed by active recovery on a treadmill with fixed intervals of 60 to 120 seconds between each workforce of series. Device: treadmill Train_Comb_aerobic

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of DAP and CI .
- Stage I or II of Fontaine .
- intermittent claudication symptoms for at least 3 months with ankle brachial index (ABI ) at rest ≤ 0.90 in 1 or 2 legs.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ischemia criticism in one of the lower limbs.
- moderate or severe ulcers on one of the lower limbs.Orthopedic issues that prevent pratical of the exercises or conducting evaluations .
- Participation in other studies with rehabilitation.
- decompensated hypertension .
- decompensated diabetes .
- Cardiovascular events less than three months .
- severe lung disease .

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital de Clínicas de Porto Alegre

facility.name: Hospital De Clínicas de Porto Alegre
